pageContext.description: A fragment of a cast copper-alloy socketed axehead dating to the Late Bronze Age (c. 1150-800 BC).  The remains of the axehead consists of a portion of the double-ribbed socket-end, remains of the loop and a portion of the body; the fragment is less than a half of the original object.  The metal is of an even dark green patina with some reddish-brown areas on the interior and a small casting bubble.  The fragment measures 47.1 mm long, 32 mm wide (socket-end), with a maximum thickness of 6.1 mm at the loop; it weighs 37.6 grams.
pageContext.notes: Finder mentions that this object may have become exposed on the beachfront during a re-grating of the shingle by a bulldozer.
